Comments: Isothermal snowpack. Generally well stabilised moist snowpack. Debris from recent cornice collapse on one of Beinn a Chaorainn's East faces.

Location: Entrance to Easy Gully, Coire Ardair.
Comments: Snowpack wet and isothermal at all elevations. Fairly recent full depth avalanche debris in many places on the Post Face. Generally stability is good though full depth avalanche potential increasing in the thaw.
Surface  soft. moist. Snowpack isothermal

Location: Coire a Chriochaerin, Boundary Wall gully
Comments: Soft moist surface snow overlies well consolidated. Snowpack isothermal. No shears noted

Location: Approach to Wall Gully, Coire Ardair.
Comments: Generally stable moist spring snowpack. Recent debris from minor wet loose snow and full depth avalanches litters the base of Easy Gully. Good stability in most locations. Large cornices remain in place.
Localised wet snow instability limited to steeper aspects. Very large cornices over NE to SE aspects. Moist, isothermal snowpack.
V light dusting overnight at summit level - thaw to all levels with sunshine (once valley fog lifted) Snowpack isothermal
soft wet surface snow, saturated layer immediately below at MF interface

Location: Approach to Wall gully, Coire Ardair
Comments: Poor visibility above 800m all day. Snowpack becoming isothermal. Early drifting but only above 950m. Minor but noticeable snow loss at lowest elevations.
Dry slab avalanche activity in the coire. Drifting up high all day. Warm in the sun at lower altitudes. Roller ball activity from rocks and crags below 700m.
Deep drifted deposits of new - fast consolidating below 800m. Reactive shears noted 12 and 24
Soft poorly bonded new slab at pit site weakness at 4 and 7. Old accumulations hard, re-frozen and stable

Location: W flank Meall Coire Choile Rais
Comments: Little new snow at the time of reporting. Some snow flurries earlier in the day. Good stability most locations, isolated pockets of colder, less well bonded windslab.

Location: Inner Coire of Coire Ardair. Below South Pipe Direct.
Comments: Slightly sun affected aspect. Weaknesses in near surface cold dry snow but very localised distribution - mainly heavily shaded areas. Moist surface snow on sun exposed aspects by midday.

Location: Carn Liath West ridge: Uinneag Coire a' Chaorainn
Comments: Failure at 15cm (Reactive).
Trace of new snow mainly at the eastern end of our area, otherwise dry. Localised instability in near surface layers of older windslab in shaded area.

Location: Below Pumpkin, Inner Coire, Coire Ardair
Comments: Localised instability, mainly shaded areas. New snow in filtered sun exposed areas bonding quickly. Huge cornices guard the entrance to Cinderella in the Inner Coire.
Breakable crust widespread below 800m. Small dusting only overnight - mizzle at pit site
Big spatial variations at pit site: E aspects well consolidated, adjacent heavily shaded NW through N to NE aspects weakly bonded slab - reactive fail at 10
Deeper new snow accumulations high on lee slopes than indicated in the profile. Instability localised. 3 small CT dry slab avalanches in the coire around midday - all new snow instability.
Late snow showers affecting the area. Isothermal snowpack at pit site. Some localised new windslab developing at altitude.
Small quantities fresh - no significant depth to new deposits at pit site. Snowpack isothermal
Snowpack moist but stable,

Difficult ob conditions. Slab avalanche activity nr pit site. Transitional. Colder, older windslab weakened with onset of milder conditions. Cold snow persists in deeper layers. Mixed form facets below a crust.
Minor facetting noted either side of a buried crust - mixed grains. Huge contrast in snow temps between sun exposed aspects and heavily shaded locations.
Very cold surface layers of new hard slab. Reactive fails at 10, 25 and 48
Small accumulations of new slab overlying hard base. Stubborn shear on layer containing graupel at 33cm

Location: SW flank Meall Coire Choille Rais
Comments: Some early facetting in layer 24cm down. Highly variable snow surface condition. Abrupt transition from boilerplate to windslab in lee areas. Instability tending to be localised.

Location: Top Of Triple Burns. Coire Ardair.
Comments: Localised instability. Strong counter winds leading to lee slope selective scouring.
Re-frozen at pit site - some light showers observed bringing new small accumulations in highest lee locations. V strong ESE winds!

Some shallow very loose wet snow grains being re-deposited in sheltered Northerly aspects - but to no significant depths. No formal pit observations possible today due to the worsening conditions at pit site.....

Location: NE ridge Meall Coire Choile Rais - above lochan
Comments: Minor surface snow instability noted but only in normally shaded areas. Moist snow below 800m widespread. Good stability in most locations.

Location: Bealach a Ghoire, Sron a Ghoire
Comments: Denser stronger slab now bridging over diminishing deep weaker layer. good stability in most locations. Pit site just below inversion level.

Location: Carn Liath West ridge: Uinneag Coire a' Chaorainn
Comments: Failures at 10cm (Reactive), 18cm (Reactive), 52cm and 76cm.
Failures at 11cm (Reactive), 14cm (Reactive), 25cm and 34cm.

Natural dry slab avalanche activity on NE to E aspects this morning. Roller ball activity on sun exposed aspects when the sun appeared. Consolidation below 750m in fluctuating temps. Sun affected pit site. Drifting all day above 850m.

Location: Immediately below The Pumpkin, Inner Coire
Comments: Highly variable pattern of stability. New snow instability in new slab and persistent weaknesses beneath older snow. Local scouring and drifting. Cross-loaded pit site.
Failures at 18cm (Reactive) and 47cm (Reactive).
Failures at 23cm (Reactive) and 48cm (Reactive).
Drifting all day. Buried weak layer failure still showing up in formal snowpit tests and hasty field tests elsewhere.

Location: Re-entrant on sidewall of Coire Ardair
Comments: Pit site in cross-loaded incised terrain feature. Facets below crust beneath slab but not widespread. New slab continues to build in very sheltered lee areas. Drifting all day. Reactive shears in new snow. Stubborn shear on facets beneath thin hard crust.
Localised S aspect in a sheltered gully line
Localised SW aspect on sheltered hollow
Drifting snow but only accumulating in very sheltered areas and hollows above 900m. Reactive shears in new snow.

Location: Steep SW flank of Meall Coire Choile Rais
Comments: Very cold air temp. Surface temp affected by sun exposed location. New slab tending to be localised. Very good stability in most other locations. Recorded new slab depth does not fully reflect the depth of build up elsewhere.

Location: SW Slope Coire Ardair on  Cairn Liath
Comments: Very light trace of new precip - mostly graupel
some small isolated weakness noted away from pit site on very hard base. Crusty below 600m

Location: Shark's Fin Gully, Carn Liath plateau
Comments: Facets below thin slab but thin and very limited distribution in shaded areas above 900m. Otherwise good stability. Sun-exposed aspects softer, esp. at lower altitudes, later.
Good stability in most places. V.thin windslab pockets in places - sporadic accumulations. Early facetting noted beneath. Heavily shaded pit site. Surprisingly breezy up high.

Very limited windblown surface deposits, these seen on very sheltered NE aspect at 800m over very hard layer , most surfaces on exposed ground above this elevations scoured   -  at pit site these deposits touchy over  hard layer
re-frozen, crust on many hillsides
Shaded location. Variable crust, some supportive, some not so. Moister snow on sun-exposed aspects later.
Isothermal snowpack. New overnight cornice debris noted on some E aspects. Trace of drifting over summits.

Location: In the environs of Balloon Gully

Comments: Breakable crust and snowpack well consolidated below 800m

Location: E ridge of Stob Coire Dubh - Coire a Bheinn side
Comments: Touchy releases in soft new slab and reactive/touchy releases in near surface older snow. Drifting all day. Widespread loose snow avalanche activity on E and SE aspects of Beinn a Chaorainn at 950m.

Location: Bottom of Balloon Gully, Coire Ardair.
Comments: 4 new snow dry slab avalanches in our area overnight/this morning. Persistent drifting all day today above 800m. Noticeable consolidation in all snow below 600m later in day. Reactive shears in new snow layers nearer the surface.

Location: Sron a Ghoire, Btm of Bumslide Gully
Comments: storm conditions on hill -low level pit not reflective of new slab above 800m
Fracture line profile. Sun affected location. Very touchy failure along avalanche failure plane. More very recent avalanche activity in the coire and on Na Cnapanan below and around 600m.

Location: Coire Chriochairein. Base of Lifa Gully.
Comments: Heavy drifting, poor stability in deepening slab. Multiple touchy shears in field tests. Several dry slab avalanches in vicinity and elsewhere. Very large cornices developing.

Location: Slope to East of Balloon Gully
Comments: New slab developing (pit temp at site on sun affected slope). Poor stability in new surface layers - older deposits consolidated
Fluctuating temps new moist surface snow. Consolidating snowpack.  Slab deposits still developing away from pit
Snow profile adjacent to avalanche crownwall. Sun affected pit site. Touchy shears in new snow layers. 4 dry slab avalanches released in the early morning on E to SE aspects.
Instability limited to areas above 950m. Clean, reactive failures in new snow at 16cm. Reactive, clean failure at 28cm.
Weakly bonded windslab. Reactive fails at  17 and 40 Breakable crust on windscoured slopes
Multiple failures in this snowpack.  Those at 10cm (Touchy) and 23cm (Reactive) were particularly noteworthy.

Location: Carn Liath West ridge: Uinneag Coire a\' Chaorainn
Comments: Failure at 4cm.
Warm in sun, numerous small single point loose releases. Snowpack consolidating, stubborn shears at 22 and 44
snowpack consolidating -stubborn shear at 17
Failures at 5cm (Reactive), 12cm (Reactive), 24cm (Stubborn) and 34cm (Stubborn).
Failures at 13cm (Reactive) and 26cm (Reactive).
Low level obs. Pit in drifted stream bed although snow to all levels little base below 700m
Wet snow rollerballs at pit site. Recent accumulations consolidating quickly stubborn shear in new at 5cm
Failures at 5cm (Reactive) and 14cm (Reactive).
Failure at 31cm (Stubborn).
wet surface layers - snowpack isothermal

Location: Approach to The Window, Inner Coire, Coire Ardair
Comments: Signs of consolidation below 850m. Weaknesses noted in other locations at altitude but not noted in snow profile.
Air temp rising after midday -  wet surface layer with pit on sun affected aspect
Limited snow observations due to very strong winds and violent gusts. Drifting most of the morning above 800m.
Isothermal snowpack where tested. Shear quality ragged in moist snow. Cornice debris in many places.
Snowpack becoming isothermal - stubborn shear in weakness at 43
Whole slope crack at test site. Rapid slab build up
Active near surface weak layer with facets. Very steep temp gradient. Profile not to ground. Cornice triggered Size 1 dry slab avalanche SE aspect at 700m early am.
Observations difficult due to deep snow on approaches. Steeper temp gradient near base of snowpack.
Deep drifts, snowpack showing consolidation at pit elevation although reactive shear still obtained in most recent layer

Location: Cairn Liath,  base of Baloon Gully
Comments: Deep drifts on approach paths - pit in  side wall of stream bed gully
Low altitude pit site. Observations and access compromised because of deep snow and constant snow showers.
Drifting of snow slow after brief overnight thaw and rain.

Location: Below The Pumpkin, Inner Coire, Coire Ardair
Comments: Snow observations taken at around the inversion line. Very unusual temperature profile through the snowpack. Profile to ground, with ground temp measured at -2.5 degrees. Deeper facetted layer unreactive in field tests.
Lingering instability at base
Facetted grains widespread in near surface and mid-pack layers. Very steep TG. Some newly drifted windslab as winds picked up later.
Variable instability. Easy shears and cracking in thinner snow. Very strong TG. Deeper snow bridging over weak layers though with less steep TG.
newly drifted accumulations
New wet snow -rapid consolation below 800m
Widespread crust below 750m. Some instability in older windslab on N & E aspects.
Notable consolidation below 800m. Easier shears in deeper snow at higher altitudes. Reactive shears at 7cm, 13cm. Just reactive at 40cm. Very poor visibility today.
Low level pit, isothermal - v poor Mt conditions
Cold surface snow - rapidly consoidating

Location: Top of Balloon Gully, Coire Ardair
Comments: Snow quite 'cheesy' in character at pit site - moist. Multiple wind changes during the day.
Shallow deposits though some snow showers came through later in the day. Very poor visibility at times.
isolated patch, drifting snow but not extensive build ups
Cold surface deposits  - temp at 8 cm  (not at 10 as shown) -2.4 cover mainly cosmetic
Very thin new build up. Patches of old snow now refrozen and hard.
Very sparse cover - isolated patches. Much exposed rock and heather. Dusting of fresh snow above 800m.
Little more than a dusting of new above 800m
Patch only
Snowpack now very patchy.
Isothermal stable snowpack, now very patchy.
Depleted, isothermal snowpack

Location: The Notch. Meall Coire Choile Rais
Comments: Isothermal snowpack. Unreactive to shear. Very poor visibility.

Location: Bottom of Easy Gully, Coire Ardair
Comments: Isothermal snowpack. Steady thaw at all altitudes.
wet surface layers - snowpack, consolidating and isothermal

Location: Coire a Chriochaerin, Boundary Wall gully
Comments: Layers consolidating,  stubborn shears noted at 38
Easier shears in deeper localised deposits at altitude. Some drifting during the morning.
